lenders.name: Sir
lenders.loan_because: Of my Needs
lenders.occupational_info:
Sir Ivan's video premiere of "For What it's Worth" off his upcoming full length album, "I Am Peaceman."
Sir Ivan "For What it's Worth" from Carlos Ramsey on Vimeo. Sir Ivan: Banker-turned-singer, peace activist, and television celebrity, Sir Ivan has led a life that movies and dreams are made of. Ivan Wilzig, the eldest son of Siggi B. Wilzig; Auschwitz survivor, legendary financier and philanthropist –turned his back on his family’s multi-billion dollar banking business to reinvent himself as Sir Ivan and follow his dream of pursuing a career in music. THE BIRTH OF “TECHNIPPY” DANCE SINGLES In 2000, while listening to John Lennon’s “Imagine,” Sir Ivan was struck by the lyrics and how closely they mirrored his own beliefs. With sudden inspiration, he realized “Imagine” was the song he would re-create as a dance record with Grammy-nominated producer Ernie Lake. Tom Silverman, owner of Tommy Boy Records, signed the record and released it one week before September 11th. Silverman’s instincts proved correct when over 10,000 DJ’s bought the vinyl version in its first four months of distribution. Sir Ivan’s “Imagine” went on to become a Top 40 hit on the Billboard Club Play Chart. Sir Ivan knew the songs he most wanted to record came from the Woodstock “hippy” music of the 60’s, with their messages of universal love and peace. Having proved that the combination of “techno” arrangements and “hippy” lyrics was a great formula for creating popular music with a positive message, Sir Ivan began to call his new sound “technippy.” Next, Grammy Award winning producer and songwriter Jellybean Benitez signed Sir Ivan to his namesake label, Jellybean Records. He put out Sir Ivan’s remake of the 1967 Scott McKenzie hit “San Francisco” and the single reached 7 on the Billboard Dance Singles Sales Chart. This attracted the attention of Daniel Glass, President of Artemis Records, who put out “Peace on Earth,” Sir Ivan’s first original song, which he also co-wrote. “Peace on Earth” not only hit the Billboard Club Play Chart, but went on to reach 2 on the Dance Music Community (DMC) World Chart. THE LAUNCH OF “ROCKTRONICA” POP/ROCK ALBUM After building his reputation in the dance music community with a string of “technippy” Billboard hits, Sir Ivan is now ready to enter the mainstream pop/rock music arena. His highly anticipated debut full length album, “I AM PEACEMAN” reinvents 15 sixties hits with a new vibe called “rocktronica,” a fusion of live rock guitar and electronic beats. The album is produced by FORD, who has 18 gold and platinum singles to his credit. It was mastered by the legendary Vlado Meller. Sir Ivan is planning a global “I AM PEACEMAN” tour with his band to commemorate the 40 Year Anniversary of Woodstock. THE CREATION OF THE PEACEMAN FOUNDATION As passionate about helping humanity as he is about his music, Sir Ivan believes that music truly can make a difference in people’s lives and affect the way they treat each other. For that reason, he created The Peaceman Foundation, a private foundation which supports an array of charities dedicated to fighting Hate Crimes and treating the victims of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). Sir Ivan is donating 100 percent of his recording artist net profits from his album to his Peaceman Foundation. To further promote peace through his music and foundation, Sir Ivan always performs in peace capes, which has earned him the title “PEACEMAN,” the rock star superhero fighting for peace. THE BREAKTHROUGH ON TELEVISION Sir Ivan recently became a TV star after appearing as a finalist on the primetime NBC Sci-Fi Channel hit series “Who Wants to Be a Superhero?” This coincided with his featured performance on VH1’s highly-rated “The Fabulous Life of the Hamptons,” the Travel Channel’s “Grand Castles of America” and the WE Channel’s “Single in the Hamptons.” The combination of the SciFi, VH1, Travel, and WE Channels simultaneously airing programs about Sir Ivan has brought him his highest popularity to date. Based on his life’s goals and ambitions, an original pilot titled “PEACEMAN” is being developed for network television. **************************************************************** Sir Ivan Live In Concert

lenders.name: www.foretagande.se
lenders.loan_because: As entrepreneurs, we see small ( and medium ) enterprises as the engine on which a country’s economy runs on. At Foretagande.se, we believe that we have the power to make other people’s lives better and their country as a whole. We see it as our social responsibility to share not just information but tangible help as well. To be part of Kiva, we see it as our opportunity to help these people support their means of livelihood and at the same time give them the chance to help others as well.
lenders.occupational_info: Foretagande.se is a community of business people, leaders and salespeople. Our team upholds the value of responsible entrepreneurship and leadership. Apart from our mission and vision to run our own successful businesses, we also aim to empower others through means of a wide network of contacts, useful information and financial resources.

You who see that experience has no coming or going,
Yet pour your energy solely into helping beings,
My excellent teachers and Lord All Seeing,
I humbly and constantly honor with my body, speech, and mind.

10
For time without beginning, mothers have lovingly cared for you.
If they are still suffering, how can you be happy?
To free limitless sentient beings,
Give rise to awakening mind 
-- this is the practice of a bodhisattva.

11
All suffering comes from wanting your own happiness.
Complete awakening arises from the intention to help others.
So, exchange completely your happiness
For the suffering of others
 -- this is the practice of a bodhisattva.

lenders.name: Alisha
lenders.loan_because:
We live in a world where, unfortunately, things are not equal.  An individual in one part of the world may be thinking when are they going to get their next new popular gadget, while another individual in a different part of the world may be thinking when are they going to be able to feed their family again.  

For those that have the means to impact people in need, it should be considered a duty, honour, and joy to help them.  By donating microfinance loans to the many entrepreneurs available through Kiva, we have an opportunity to open doors for many individuals all over the world.  $25 is not a lot to ask for from someone who can give, considering many of us likely spend that going out for dinner one night, buying a new movie, or trying to fill a tank of gas.  I choose to loan because, fortunately, I can and I know it’s making a significant difference in someone else’s life.

“I am only one, but I am one.  I cannot do everything, but I can do something.  And I will not let what I cannot do interfere with what I can do.” – Edward Everett Hale
lenders.occupational_info: I help provide the managers and employees that I support with advice and direction in various areas of human resources, including: career development, performance management, compensation & benefits, job evaluations, succession planning, and recruitment.  It is a rewarding position knowing that you’ve been able to make an impact in someone’s life through the advice you give.

lenders.name: Darren Weeks
lenders.occupational_info:
I am the Founder and CEO of the Fast Track Group, an Alberta-based 
financial education and investment company that is teaching and inspiring Canadians to become financially free.

I grew up in a middle class family in Edmonton. I went to the University of Alberta and received a Bachelor of Commerce degree in accounting, got married young, worked as an employee, and decided that I wanted more out of life than the pressures of a 9 to 5 JOB.

This traditional job took time away from the thing I liked best...investing! I've been investing all my life. In fact, I started investing in mutual funds and penny stocks in elementary school, moved to precious metals in high school and became a multi-property real estate investor while at the University.

I was inspired to even greater action by Robert Kiyosaki, author of “Rich Dad Poor Dad,” whose principles confirmed what I already knew - financial education enables people to take control of their financial futures and that real estate investments were the fast track to financial freedom.

The Rich Dad principles gave me the confidence to invest bigger and go faster. I have a track record of success through involvement in hundreds of real estate transactions, individually and with joint-venture partners.

I've been following my mission to provide Canadians with the fast track to financial literacy, financial well-being and financial freedom so they can improve their lives and realize their dreams.

Since 2001 when I launched Fast Track to Cash Flow, more than 250,000 people have attended my educational events in Canada. As CEO of the Fast Track Group, I travel throughout Canada giving free seminars and hosting Rich Dad CASH FLOW® games.

For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink, I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.' They also will answer, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?' He will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did not do for one of the least among you, you did not do for me.'"
